page.title: Achievement, octane fever, & justice.
page.subtitle: The possibilities (and perils) of the unfettered creative mind.

page.title: Follow a mind freed by a massive choice.
page.paragraph: Unleashed by a fresh bounty of exceptional images and type, a creative mind in pursuit of a great idea can follow some pretty strange paths. No I-can't-pull-that-off doubting. Every tangent gets followed Every leap of consciousness gets chased.
page.paragraph2: Choice rules at Veer, where 100,000 new rights-managed images - some of the finest typography from the world's largest digital collection - are now available. High-concept mind-blowers, historical and editorial juwels, natural wonders, fashion and beauty stunners, and such more. Plus we're introducing Cherry, bright, contemporary, soulful rights-managed illustrations.
page.paragraph3: The fetters are off. Let your mind wander

page.h1: Need a concept for selling dog snacks.
page.title: Need caffeine. Triple shot, no foam. What's the angle?
page.h2: Taste? Crunchability? "Meaty" Goodness? Why buy a dog snack? Why have a dog?
page.paragraph: A pet is a wild animal curled up at the end of your bed. We love dogs because they don't have cellphones (yet). Dogs connect us to nature.

page.title: Dirt, the smell of a forest, where food comes from.

page.h1: I hunted for neo-retro sneakers at that
page.title: Slick mall. Slick is cool.
page.h2: Nowadays everything has to be cool. Dog bones need to be cool. They need to be... Bauhaus. Modernism.
page.paragraph: Mods on Italian scooters. Clean living under German aesthetics. Less is more. Less is more what? Image? Can't we just talk? Will anybody listen if we just use words?

page.h1: Just words. Dog people are down-to-earth. (except pink poodle-people).
page.title: You can say a lot with words.
page.h2: But it doesn't hurt to dress 'em up. Killer coctail dress? Friendly sweater?
page.paragraph: A friendly sweater like you'd wear in a Christmas TV special.

page.h1: Christmas in the mountains. Wooly sweaters. Big smiles. Hungry bears.
page.title: Would your dog fight a bear for you?
page.h2: Would snack gratitude buy his loyalty? "These snacks will save you from a bear attack." That's a killer value proposition.
page.paragraph: But really the only bears most people worry about are the Wall street kind. Especially accountants.

page.h1: I've seen accountants pick up poo.
page.title: More bears? No, bulls. Bull markets. Wildebeests.
page.h2: Not beests. Beasts. Monsters. Like in a kids' story.

page.h1: For some people, dogs are kids. Just hairier.
page.title: Why not doggy storybooks?
page.h2: "Scrumptious flocks of chubby rabbits, in little jackets made of bacon, wandered about - slow and fatty for the picking."
page.paragraph: Nah. Most dogs are city dogs. Gotta keep it real.

page.h1: Real but surreal. A dog luncheon at some swell café.
page.title: It'll be the algonquin hound table.
page.h2: Yikes, what an awful pun. Typical cutesy ad trick. Enough of that.
page.paragraph: Think big and bold. Less cute. More cutting-edge. ASPIRATION.

page.h1: Yes, let's aim higher. Let's honour the honourable: achievement.
page.title: Feats of engineering.
page.h2: Courtesy of the human mind. Bigger bridges. Better bones.
page.paragraph: But where's the love? The emotional connection?

page.h1: To connect you have to engage. To engage you need to, umm, blow things up!
page.title: Octane fever! This is how they grab eyeballs in la-la land.
page.h2: Speed thrills. No reason it can't sell dog snacks.
page.paragraph: Car chases. Dog chase cars. We chase cars vicariously through our dogs - we envy their freedom. This is about freedom!

page.h1: Freedom? Heck, they sell chewing gum as fre
page.title: These snacks are sweet liberty. Or justice even. Yes, dog snacks are justice.
page.h2: Not sure we can deliver this benefit. Something less noble. More modern but, sti
ll with a wiff of virtue. vitality?

page.h1: Vitality is a solid benefit. Vitality=dancing seniors or surfing seniors or frisky seniors. Or...
page.title: Jet fighters! With massive supersonic, super-vital missiles.
page.h2: Woah! Missiles? Not missiles. Mistletoe. Eggnog. Eggnog latte.

page.title: What was that cool idea I just had?
page.h2: Jet-fighting dog-pilots? Cars jumping L.A.? Freedom? Justice? Bauhaus?
page.paragraph: What does any of this have to do with dog snacks? Still, I might lay out a few when I get to the office.

page.title: Cherry got soul.
page.paragraph: The vibe is personal, real. The feel is hand-done, less slick. This is Cherry, Veer's new rights-managed illustration collection.
page.paragraph2: Cherry reflects the trend in illustration toward a more DIY/analog aesthetic. And with contributions from over 20 top illustrators, it runs the gamet style-wise. More than just a looker, Cherry infuses whatever is adorns with authenticity. And a little soul
page.paragraph3: Features exclusive works from Kirsten Ulve, Nick Dewar, James O' Brien, Frederico Jordán, Richard Downs, and many other bright lights of modern illustration. A Veer Exclusive

page.title: It's a wonderful lightbox!
page.paragraph: Your search for the just-right image or typeface has got you down. Where do you turn? Veer’s researchers are here, creating a lightbox of relevant selections, often within hours. And it’s free. Free to all. The Savings and Loan brochure is saved! In the distance, a bell rings.

page.title: The magnificent sven.
page.h3: This model really gets around. Place to place. Mood to mood. Wife to wife.
page.paragraph: Having a variety of images featuring the same model can come in handy. Find them easily with Veer’s new Same Model search. Just click “Find more images with model(s) shown above” whenever you see the link on a Fancy or Solus image and every photograph featuring that model will be displayed.

page.title: Merchy Christmas!
page.paragraph: A sackful of new merch – our biggest ever – has arrived. Just in time for holiday gifting and getting. The Kern Arrows zip-up is a Veer classic taken in a new direction. A bright collection of lights and lamps will set the mood at work or home. Plus toys, tees, and a cozy ‘n’ cool type scarf – perfect stocking stuffers.
page.h2: see all veer’s giFtables at veer.com/merch
